column5: Thanks Ryan!!!  I'm ready as I ever will
Very nice. Leechman lures, get them while they are hot!
Thanks Johnny!!!  Next on the menu is slip bobber type rigs..... purchased enough pill sized floats to make a few    and last a while
Nice work The pike do love spinner baits for sure I like that pattern on the crank baits

I can't believe you'd post pictures of that stuff.  I'll take them from you and save you the embarrassment of showing others.  You can thank me later.     Nice work Jaques!!   Now go get some teeth marks in them.
Thanks Mike!!!  The cranks are going to be killer..... just have a good feeling about them   LOL Thanks fishnsled!!!  How much you willing to pay for them beauts    I sure will
Nice work Jacques! Keep it up!
Great job on the spinners and cranks! I have tried making spinners but need to go to remedial wire-bending school...
You're getting carried away Jacques, you already catch too many fish and now it'll be even more!  Great job, those spinner baits are sweet and those cranks are spectacular.
Excellent job on those baits Leechman.I particularly like the chaurtruse spinner bait. Its always been one of my favorite colors for bass...

Thanks Vinni!!!   Thanks NWO Fishing!!!  Got to take the wire bending real slow.... once the loop is done, closing the gap is just as slow   Am I really??  Thanks Chris!!! I can't wait to give those a try   Thanks ChrisK!!! Yeah chartreuse is one of my favorite too.... including white

Like the title says.... just finished making my very first spinnerbaits, thought I'd share to results  Love this one and I think it's going to be killer.... added trailer hooks to them for better hook set        Threesome    Tight lines Leechman
Ohhhh, I like the yellow one!!!  You did a fine job on all tho, they look great!!  Joey
Thanks Joey!!!
I do believe thats chartreuse LOL good job Leechman
nice!!
Good job Jacques, i also like the chartreuse one. Dunno why i like it....considering i've never thrown a spinnerbait in my life!

Thanks SRT8!!!   Thanks Chris!!!   Thanks Simon!!!  Now that I got familiar with the components required to build one, I will buy them in bulk instead of kits and my favorite color is white  You should try them on your home lake Simon, they're a real pike and bass magnet
Nice work, Jacques!  Red and black looks killer, but, chartreuse is my go to colour.

Thanks Frank!!!  Chartreuse or white, both are good colors.... I was hoping that the kits would have a least one white but didn't.... next order will get white skirts with colorado & willowleaf blades  Now I got to work on the 2-3/4" bass crankbaits...... and guess what color they are going to be???   Yeah...... white and chartreuse
Those look great!

Nice work Leechman! I tried making those but I couldnt get the loops bent in the wire without ruining them. Is there a trick im missing? I was thinking a wire bender would be nice but I dont have the extra $ to buy one..Good work once again!
Dont you have enough to do already?LOL  Nice work.

Thanks bassmaster4!!!   Thanks tb4me!!!  All you need are needle nose pliers.... trick to it is to leave a 1/4" of wire past where you set your pliers and slowly bend the wire inward.... don't rush it and take you time.  Once the loop is created, you have to close the gap by squeezing it together.... again very slowly.... my first try was perfect, second was a little short and had to ajust, third was spick & span   Thanks Brian!!!  Yes I still do..... that was just to relax a bit     Can't blame a guy for trying
Hey nice job!! i bought some walley harness kits and some french spinner kits.Saving them for january when i normally go into hibernation mode.
Thanks Paul!!!  This is my hibernation time    come hard water, it's a whole new season til March 31st  Then April it's square tails again
hey jacques maybe i'll become a master of baits this winter.
They look awesome  jacques
That's a possibility Paul.... only time will tell Good luck with the bait making   Thanks Dutchy!!!
Awesome job Jacques!  Really diggin' the 3D eyes...They just scream eat me
Thanks Mike!!!  Good observation   don't they look real hey? Smallest item in the kit and makes a big difference look wise
Just finished 3 additional rattling crankbaits for the tackle box  Color pattern.... Leechman special    Tight lines Leechman
Sweet spinnerbaits and cranks leechman! Gotta love the custom 'firetiger' paintjob too  Where can we find out more about making spinnerbaits?
Thanks fishindude!!!  Got to Luremaking.com they have all the required components you need to know about making lures and great price too
canadianluremaking.com  got everything you need.
They Look awesome to me!  Betcha can't wait for Ice-Out gators now Jaques!
